subject: A convention to be kept?
msgSnippet: The apostrophy works well in T.O. to show the difference between plural, possesive and plural possesive case. It was recently pointed out to me that even in
messageBody:
The apostrophy works well in T.O. to show the difference between
plural, possesive and plural possesive case. It was recently pointed out
to me that even in phonetic writing it would still be usefull. In the
Quickscript manual it is used in abbreviations like he'd and he'll
though I am yet to find a place where it marks plurals.

I aggre that Junior form is the best for printing and computer
workings. Senior form on computer would have to work something like
Japanese, where at least three display options are given after writing
each word.

P.S. Is there a combining mark in the Unicode standard that looks like
the accent marker used on page 11 of the Quickscript manual?
